pages.text: Vagrants possess a limited degree of control over the behavior of other parasites, allowing them to divert attention towards certain threats. This is usually done when attacking a target, as all nearby parasites will close in on it to attack.
It appears that, if they don't have a target to attack and the Vagrant has juristiction over them, parasites will follow the Vagrant around if they aren't hiding.

Parasites will also attack enemies that are targeting a Vagrant, provided they aren't busy with another threat already and, again, the Vagrant is not hiding. They will only change attack targets if their original target has died or left their purview, or if the Vagrant initiates combat. That includes being attacked.
